body: Thanks for the report. We look at it and come back to you.

issue.title: fix: Circular references with generic types.

repository.name: spoon
repository.description: Spoon is a metaprogramming library to analyze and transform Java source code. :spoon: is made with :heart:, :beers: and :sparkles:. It parses source files to build a well-designed AST with powerful analysis and transformation API.

issue.body:
> With this PR, we can apply Spoon on RxJava. :)

When you have an invocation to a method with this
kind of reference : <T extends Comparable<? extends T>>,
you got a circular reference and a StackOverflowException.
With this PR, we add a cache which detects circular references
in JDTTreeBuilder and uses this information in
CtScanner and DefaultJavaPrettyPrinter.

Closes #368

issue.title: fix: Circular references with generic types.

body:
> I think you didn't specify all dependencies of RxJava in your classpath.

Yep, you're right. My apologies!

That said, glad you gave the sources a try yourself and were able to get farther along to see the stack overflow exception. Using both #372 and #374 fix that problem locally and let me proceed in experimentation. So thanks for that.

However, I'm also writing the code back out and seeing if it compiles which it currently does not. At the very least there's a lot of problems with lambda argument casts and wildcards. There's also a few other one-offs. I can try to isolate them down to small test cases, but having almost no familiarity with Spoon or the JDT I'm mostly fumbling around and moving slowly. So if you're able to keep going using the RxJava sources to identify problems, it would be much appreciated. If not, I'll get around to trying to craft test cases eventually.

> Using both #372 and #374 fix that problem locally and let me proceed in experimentation. So thanks for that.

Cool! That is a good first point.

> At the very least there's a lot of problems with lambda argument casts and wildcards.

Yep, I see them. Don't worry, we are working on it.

> but having almost no familiarity with Spoon or the JDT I'm mostly fumbling around and moving slowly.

I don't know what you do with Spoon (that should be cool to know by curiosity), but there are tutorials available on our website (http://spoon.gforge.inria.fr/index.html). If there are parts not clear, don't hesitate to report them!

issue.title: fix: Parameters in a lambda expression.

repository.name: spoon
repository.description: Spoon is a metaprogramming library to analyze and transform Java source code. :spoon: is made with :heart:, :beers: and :sparkles:. It parses source files to build a well-designed AST with powerful analysis and transformation API.

issue.body:
From now, we don't re-print type of parameters of lambda
if original sources don't specify it. We print the name
of these parameters and we save the expected type in the
AST.

Issue #368

body: I re-open it. I forgot to remove the "Closes #368" in my previous commit message.

body:
Well, with the latest version of Spoon from the master branch or the latest snapshot version (available tonight when our Jenkins will deploy it), I can apply Spoon on RxJava without any problem but I can't re-compile the source code, I have an error weird: "incompatible type" but the source code seems equivalent to the original.

@JakeWharton Can you say me if everything is good or if there is still a problem?
I was able to pass all the sources through Spoon and do a full compile using the latest `master`.
